commentable_entity.ask: Cancel “Cancel Culture” and Be The Solution & Not The Problem
commentable_entity.title: Cancel “Cancel Culture” and Be The Solution & Not The Problem
commentable_entity.description:
Cancel culture has been in full force for years now, often ending careers of celebrities and everyday working class people alike, at times with very little evidence to back up the claims being made. So many people lost everything, including their jobs after what many would call one bad day. A father flips out after his sons smoothie order was made with an ingredient he specifically asked to be left out, leading to an allergic reaction. The father was upset, rightfully so, but the young staff choose to hit record instead of apologizing to the man. A women pushed to the edge after being told to put an a mask resulting in a temper tantrum of sorts in a Target, again staff and customers choosing to hit record instead of asking if she was ok. Both individuals lost their jobs, jobs they had held for years. 

We also saw cancel culture in real time when Amber Heard made domestic violence claims about her then husband Johnny Depp back in 2016. News papers ran with the story, with little attention to the facts. Amber Heard took it a step further by writing an opinion piece, conveniently timed to sync up with the release of  the blockbuster movie Aquaman where she played the main character’s love interest Mera. Amber’s wrote, “I spoke up against sexual violence — and faced our culture’s wrath. That has to change.”, adding that the “wrath” occurred two years prior, lining up with her marriage to Johnny Depp  

Johnny Depp, just days after the article was published, was released from multiple franchises, including Fantastic Beasts and Pirates. Johnny was essentially blacklisted in Hollywood with no way to defend himself  

Johnny Depp was able to fight, ensuring that the real truth be heard after a 6 week long trial in Virginia where JD accused Amber Heard of deformation. The jury in this trial determined that Amber made up the abuse claims with actual malice in mind, awarding JD just under $11 million dollars.

But what happens to those who can’t fight or explain what really occurred? They just lose, everything. 

Stand up and demand the facts before jumping into the band wagon of cancel culture.  
Be part of the solution, make better choices and remember that even the smallest false accusation can change EVERYTHING for the person accused.
commentable_entity.letter_body: Cancel “Cancel Culture” and Be The Solution & Not The Problem
commentable_entity.display_title: Cancel “Cancel Culture” and Be The Solution & Not The Problem
